campaign.story:
Keen Nut Butter has been around for a mere six months and it's been an absolute roller-coaster of a ride from a small market concept to a company on the brink of rapid growth.  Just this week Keen has been declared one of the "Top 20 Irish Food Finds to Watch in 2014".  There's nothing better than being a food producer in Ireland - the industry is absolutely buzzing and if you take a look at the Top 20 you'll see what incredibly innovative products are being produced.    

Even with all the success Keen has experienced, I'm still a small food producer and I make nut butter because I believe the product is amazing and better than anything you can currently buy - not for the money (money?). As with most food producers in their first year of business, there's literally no room for 'extras'. 
Which brings me to the reason for this Kickstarter Project: I would love to enter Keen Nut Butter into the Great Taste Awards. As a small producer, being awarded Great Taste stars is truly a sign that you are producing a product that is top notch and one that needs to be shouted about. 
Yes, yes yes. We (you and I) already shout about Keen Nut Butter because we know it's a fabulously delicious alternative to peanut butter. But think about how much louder we would be heard if our megaphone was covered in twinkly Great Taste stars? 
Last year, I was a touch too late to enter the awards but as Keen Nut Butter is preparing to launch into mainland UK in the next couple of months, it seems like the perfect time to gain a bit of recognition for our artisan products.  I think Keen stands a chance of really shining at the Great Taste Awards in 2014 and if you think so too, then please make a pledge to help me enter.  
What the Project Goal covers 
Update: We've hit this goal!  Pat yourselves on the back! 
The cost of entering 5 different products in the awards, thus increasing our chance of making a huge splash if we win several stars. We're star-greedy. The flavours entered will be: Almond Smooth, Almond Crunchy, Almond Cinnamon, Hazelnut Cinnamon and Pecan Maple.
Shipping costs to ship the tasters to the judges. 5 products x hundreds of judges can add up! 
Cost of a roller banner and new display boards to use at GTA events.  
Cost of new labelling to highlight stars awarded.  
Cost of flight and hotel to UK to attend GTA ceremony. 
Rewards for all of our beautiful supporters. 
How the Great Taste Awards are judged
The thing that I really like it about the GTA is that each product isn't competing against similar items.  They're judged individually and given 0-3 stars based on the deliciousness of that particular product.  This means that by entering all 10 of our commercially available flavours we're not competing against ourselves, each product just needs to be wonderfully tasty. Which they are (yay!).  
To read all about the Great Taste Awards, you can visit their official website.  
Stretch Goals
Update: We've hit every one of these stretch goals!  I'm very proud of the foodies in Ireland, the UK and Canada for spreading the work and making this happen! Well done you.
£900 - I'll enter our Macadamia White Chocolate Nut Butter. £950 - I'll enter our Almond Vanilla Nut Butter. £1000 - I'll enter our Hazelnut Dark Chocolate Nut Butter. 

Super Stretch Goals
Time for some super stretch goals then, eh? 
Super Super Stretch #1 £1,600: Cover the costs of going to the Harrogate Speciality Show  This is a trade event with with thousands of food hall buyers and independent retailers hoping to find the next delicious taste to bring into their shops. That delicious taste could be Keen! This would cover the basics for the event: stall fee, pallet delivery of goods and travel.   
Super Super Stretch #2 £2,050: Cover the costs of going to the Balmoral Show
Ireland's largest agricultural and food event. This would simply cover the cost of a stall in the NI Food Pavillion.
Super Stretch #3: £2,500: EITHER cover the costs of going to London's Speciality Food Show in September OR providing our products for the April Flavr Box.  It's your choice - let me know which you'd prefer in the comments.  Either opportunity is a great way to promote Keen within mainland UK. 
Why I want to enter as many flavours as I can...
When people are taste-testing our nut butters, it seems like everyone has their favourite.  William will argue passionately that Almond Vanilla is the best, but Katie is a staunch Almond Smooth supporter. This makes it hard to select just one or two flavours - imagine if I entered Almond Crunchy and the judges were all Smooth lovers!?  The shame. 
From a business perspective, winning stars opens doors.  Simple as that. Just as an Oscar win raises the profile of an actress, GTA stars make products very appealing to both consumers and buyers from those gorgeous food halls we all want to be in.  
What if Keen doesn't win any stars?
If Keen doesn't win any stars (really?), then the money pledged towards the promotional materials, packaging and flight will go towards attendance at one of the BBC Good Food shows.  
What if Keen wins a whole she-bang of stars? 
If that happens, it will be because of the support you've given me. Hence, it's only sensible that you're rewarded in kind (I'm sure you'll agree, yeah?) Check out the bonus rewards that I'll send out if we start raking in the stars...

5 stars - every supporter will receive a bonus mini-jar of their choosing. 
10 stars - every supporter will receive a full-sized jar of their choosing.  
Why haven't I done a video for this Kickstarter project?
As fun as it was to create the video for the last Kickstarter project, we just don't have the time to put towards it this go-round. Our Keen Nut Butters are in such high demand that I'm working about 20 hours a day trying to fill orders. Any video created would be a blur of smooshing and tiredness!  To boot, I used up my video editing favours for the last project and fear that asking again would only result in my husband imploding from work stress. 
The delicious world of Keen
If you're debating over which reward to choose, perhaps a browse through the list of flavours might help? 

Standard (190ml Jars)
Almond Smooth 
Almond Crunchy
Almond Cinnamon 
Almond Vanilla Pod
Almond Dark Chocolate
Almond Sour Cherry - Kickstarter only flavour!
Almond Espresso - Kickstarter only flavour!
Almond Honey - Kickstarter only flavour! 
Hazelnut Cinnamon
Hazelnut Dark Chocolate
Three-Nut (Almond, Hazelnut & Cashew) - Kickstarter only flavour!

Premium
Pecan Maple
Macadamia White Chocolate
Cashew Dark Chocolate - Kickstarter only flavour!
Macadamia White Chocolate Cranberry - Kickstarter only flavour! 
We've got Add-ons! 
These are great if you just want to add another flavour to your pledge! Here’s how it works: Increase your pledge by the cost of the desired add-on(s) without changing your selected reward tier. After the end of the Kickstarter campaign, you’ll receive a survey where you can confirm which add-on(s) you wanted. 

UK Shipping Add-ons (includes price of shipping): 
£12 - Any Standard Jar of Nut Butter
£15 - Any Premium Jar of Nut Butter

Outside UK Add-ons (includes price of shipping):
£18 - Any Standard Jar of Nut Butter
£21 - Any Premium Jar of Nut Butter
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I know the ins and outs of the Keen supply chain well enough to be confident that I can fulfil the rewards during the month of March. I've enlisted a number of friends to help with fulfilment (I make, they pack and ship) and have selected our printing service for t-shirts & aprons as well as our courier service for overseas shipments - I anticipate with this gang at the ready we should be able to get your rewards to you quickly.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, 
We're a touch behind getting your lovely butters out to you, but we're starting shipping them today so they'll be in your hands and on your tongues soon.
I'll post some photos of our Smoosher Jenny as she attempts to take a stack to the post.
For those of you who have opted into being on our Spreading the Love mailing list, you'll be receiving your first email soon as we send out a coupon for an upcoming market we're at.  Most of our emails aren't quite so location specific, so apologies to those of you that live outside of Northern Ireland!

updates.update_userinfo: Just had to share this with you!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, 

I'm so excited I'm bursting.  I've just received an official invitation to be a judge at The Great Taste Awards this year!  

This is such an honour and great recognition as a food producer.  A huge amount of this recognition comes from running this campaign with all of you and I wanted to say thanks for all the support.  

On the rewards side of things, we've finished compiling what you'd like (if you don't have your survey back to us yet, hop to it!) and we'll be starting to send out rewards in the next day or two.  It's been interesting seeing what you've chosen (cashew dark choc, anyone?) and we're excited to make these Kickstarter-only flavours for you.

updates.update_userinfo: Factory nearly ready to start producing your rewards!
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone, 
I hope everyone is staying warm this week - over here we're doing our best to keep warm by building shelves, painting and generally turning a blank little unit into a Keen-inspired factory space.  We've got about another week of settling in before we start producing your lovely rewards - the t-shirt, apron and tea towel designs are all ready to go and they'll be the same ones that the production team wears in the factory or to markets.

updates.update_userinfo: Preparing surveys... we'll be sending out your nut butter soon!
updates.update_content: It's 6am on Sunday morning and the campaign that you've all so generously given time, money and effort to comes to an end in a few hours with an incredible 307% raised and all the goals fully funded.  You've managed to provide me with the funds to really promote Keen throughout the year and hopefully make a huge splash at the Great Taste Awards.  If we do achieve that, who knows what will happen next!  I'll be dragging each and every one of you along for that ride - I'll keep on using the Kickstarter platform to blog about how we're doing and let you know as we're shippping out the rewards.

updates.update_userinfo: Are you snoozing over the finish line?
updates.update_content:
Let's start with the bad, because it's really not *THAT* bad.  

I received a letter from the beautiful people at Ballymaloe yesterday.  (Super stretch goal #2: attend Ballymaloe LitFest).  As it turns out, they're only accepting applications for The Big Tent for food that you can purchase and eat right then.  Although I have stumbled upon people with their fingers in the jar soon after purchase, I don't think we qualify.  The upside is that by the time the LitFest rolls around, you should be able to buy Keen Nut Butter in the Ballymaloe Cookery School Shop, so we'll be there in spirit (and product).

updates.update_userinfo: The good news or the bad news first?
updates.update_content:
Hello!  I hope everyone is making it through January and starting to notice signs of spring (at least in Northern Ireland the crocuses are poking their heads up) - not so in Canada. 
This Blue Monday I received the news that Keen has been awarded a Creative Voucher worth £3,000 which is funded by the Department for Culture, Arts and Leisure (DCAL) and managed by NORIBIC in partnership with CultureTECH, Digital Circle and C-TRIC.  Quite a mouthful, but a huge opportunity for me!

updates.update_userinfo: Keen awarded a Creative Marketplace Voucher
updates.update_content:
Hello supporters! 
A few pieces of news to share as the rain is hammering down on Northern Ireland... 
Harrowgate: We're now only about £67 away from reaching our second Suuuuper Stretch goal to attend the Harrogate Speciality Show.  I've been talking with the organisers of the show to secure a tentative spot and also speaking with them about participating in their Feed the Dragon event - a dragon's den for food producers that allows you to introduce your product to some top buyers.  I'll jump into that!

updates.update_userinfo: Add-ons added and Great Taste Award update
updates.update_content:
Evening everyone, 
Today I mailed in my application to be a part of the Big Shed at the Ballymaloe LitFest.  The Big Shed, which is considered the heartbeat of this festival, sounds like the perfect place to spend three busy food-filled days: 
As per the LitFest.ie website:
"The space may be big, but the atmosphere is cosy. Gardeners will again interact with cooks, foragers with food historians, critics with musicians, artisan food producers with bloggers, writers with readers and so on. There will be brewers, bakers, and candlestick makers. Under this great roof will be a bubbling stew of ideas, thoughts and conversations. There will be delicious things to eat and drink, great books to read, songs to be sung, toes to be tapped and tunes to be hummed. There will be fun to be had by young and old with the family area a buzzing hive of activity. Artists and craft makers will join the fray with their foodie related wares. This is the red hot chill out spot, the place to expect the unexpected, the chance to sit beside your neighbour or you hero –or both. You can do lots here or nothing- you can just be."

campaign.story:
THIS PROJECT HAS ENDED. HOWEVER...
 www.JapaneseTheGame.com
I lived in Japan a decade ago and, through hard experience and hard work, I learned how the Japanese Language works.  I had taken college classes, tried to study on my own, and even moved there, but I was still struggling to say everyday things like "That soup was delicious," and "Actually, I'm too short to play football." Eventually I got a good grasp of the language and got rather fluent, but I felt terrible for the other English speakers who were new or never seemed to catch on.
When I got back to the States, I saw that a lot of good programs like Rosetta Stone and Pimsleur were available for a whole lot of money and people were still buying them up, spending hundreds of dollars at a time. But what if you don't always have a computer or CD player with you, or what if you want to learn with friends? And learning certainly shouldn't be so expensive. So to make it easier for the rest of the world I cracked the code for you, breaking almost the whole language down into manageable concepts. It took a lot of time and failed attempts, but after six years of rethinking, simplifying, and revising, I've created this card game that makes learning Japanese fun, fast, and easy!
 The cards in this game have Japanese words on them, along with markings that help you put them together in complete, grammatically correct sentences every time. Here's an example sentence:
 These cards come together to make a sentence that means...
..."The cat sniffs."  Swap out nouns, verbs, etc., to make your own sentences.  Be smart or silly and have fun with it.
As you can see, the cards have English letters on them, so you don't have to know Japanese at all to play a fun, fast game and learn some Japanese vocabulary and grammar almost by accident. Here's a close-up sample of the card for Dog:
The First Edition will have fresh background images. A dog, for instance.
This game puts the language right in your hands, helping you learn at your own pace.  Even my 11-year-old cousin is pretty good at it. I want everyone who is interested in learning Japanese to be able to take a deck anywhere they go and share the Japanese language with their friends.
For students who happen to be learning the Japanese writing systems of Hiragana and Katakana or Kanji, this game is an excellent help. In fact, if you're studying Japanese, there's even a pledge level at which I will turn your vocabulary list into a deck! And you can get enough for your whole class, or have them join you in a pledge to pool your resources and benefit the whole class.  Each deck has 52 cards, which is enough for two players (because you need at least 25 cards per player).  The 36-cards expansions enable one more player to join the game while bringing you more vocabulary, grammar, and even strategic dimensions!
The game is played like a live-action version of Mad Libs.  The cards in your hand are words, and you use them to make sentences.  You can play with a shared deck or players can bring their own.
Solo Mode - Build sentences to get to 20 points in as few turns as you can, or go until you've used every card in the deck!
Collaborative Mode - Get together with a friend or two or three and take turns building, expanding, splitting, and re-building each other's sentences!
Competitive Mode - Every card you play can increase the number of points you have on your side of the table.  You can use the points you place on your side within a given turn to eliminate opponents' cards--end even complete sentences--to set them back while at the same time you make progress toward your own goal!  
I've made a rather silly, roughly 10 minute-long video of this mode, which you can watch below. (You can get the feel of the game in about three minutes, though.) It may be a little loud depending on your computer.
PLAY

I believe breaking down the language barrier will increase love and understanding between Japanese and English-speaking cultures.  There is so much to be gained by bringing our world-leading cultures together in friendship.  So if you love games, love Japan, or love languages, it's time to learn, grow, and increase peace!
I'm doing this Kickstarter to pay for printing the first complete edition of the game and six expansions: Japanese Food, Anime, Travel, Business, Monsters (Kaijū), and an intermediate-level Conjugations Expansion!
If you want, the limited Shōgun backer level allows you to pick what words you want to be in a deck or expansion!  Do you want words to form a certain phrase?  "You are my sunshine." "What does the fox say?" "I am the one who knocks." "Objection overruled."  You can have it!  The more funds we raise, the more cards we can put in the core deck and the more expansions we can afford to print.
I will also use some funds to make a truly excellent series of free Japanese Instruction videos.  These lessons and question-and-answer sessions will allow learners to get more familiar with the language, regardless of whether they've even heard of the game.  Naturally I'll make videos for the game as well, but I feel like I've been given this amazing gift and I really want to share it.  For this, I'll need better video and sound equipment.
This is the updated break-down for the backer levels available in this Kickstarter:
Note: The $1 Donation pledge level now gets a Print-and-Play First Edition Core Deck instead of the Beta because of a stretch goal we met.
I hope this chart makes sense.  If it doesn't, please message me directly.
We've funded successfully, AND beaten our first through fourth stretch goals!
UNLOCKED!! $7,000: A 5-card "Politeness" mini-expansion right inside the box that will enable you to make any sentence in the game into a Formal one.  That will make the Japanese teachers happy, along with everyone you meet if you should venture to the Land of the Rising Sun.
UNLOCKED!! $20,000: Everyone who backs at $10 or more will get a Permanent Subscription to a Print-and-Play PDF of every Core Deck and expansions we ever make!  This will never happen outside of this Kickstarter campaign, so take advantage!
UNLOCKED!! $25,000: I will add a blank sheet of cards to the Print-and-Play so you can make cards to suit your own vocabulary goals!
UNLOCKED!! $42,000: I will make a Business Expansion with words like Office, Commute, Co-worker, etc.  More details here.
UNLOCKED!! Reaching 1,000 Facebook Likes has unlocked a Free Android and iPhone app that reads your cards and speaks the native Japanese pronunciation!
UNLOCKED!!: $64,000: We will get a MONSTERS (Kaijuu) EXPANSION with art by professional Japanese monster artist Micah Hornung. More details here.
UNLOCKED!!: $85,000: I will create a Conjugations Expansion Deck so you can learn how to put verbs and adjectives into other tenses and forms like past, command, negative, likely, apparent, and others. This will train your brain to use more sophisticated Japanese. You might consider this an intermediate pack.
UNLOCKED!!: $96,000: Unlocked the Daimyō backer level with one Core Deck, all six Expansions, and a free Japanese: The Game Two-piece Card Box. It's 9'' long (28cm) so it will hold all the cards in the backer level along with a few more expansions as you continue to build your vocabulary.  The card box is also  available as an add-on; you just increase your pledge amount by $12 to get one.
UNLOCKED!!: 2500 Backers: Everyone will get four more cards in the Core Deck AND all the $1 Backers get the First Edition Print-and-play instead of just the Beta. (They don't get a Print-and-Play of all the Expansions, but every level $10 and up does.)
FINAL ROLLING STRETCH GOAL!!: I increased the deck by one card at $110,000 and will continue to add one card for every $2,000 we raise thereafter.
I thank you all for your tremendous support! This has been a runaway success and I can't wait to deliver your cards and make more Japanese: The Game throughout 2014 and hopefully forever!
This game has a lot of expansion potential to help you learn the language and culture of Japan, so I'm going to keep going on this. Now that we've funded successfully, I'm going to fulfill this project and go on to make expansions for People, Numbers, Grade-level Kanji sets, The JPLT and BJT regulation langauage tests, and more!
I'd love to hear from you, even if you don't back my project, about why you did or didn't, and I'll be contacting every one of you who backs me to thank you personally because this is something we're doing together.  It's a big undertaking, but I've already done most of the work and with your backing, we'll be able to make this a great game for anyone to study Japanese in groups in a way that's fun and engaging... so we can share the excitement of learning a new language and culture with everyone!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Challenge: Creation logistics
It takes a lot of work hours to get new vocabulary turned into cards. With the Teacher and Professor contributor levels, fulfillment times are extended beyond the normal project for this reason. But even with the couple expansions we're making, a hundred or so new word cards will need to be created. Fortunately, I have written software that creates the cards after I populate a spreadsheet. I've already created about 60 cards this way, so the challenge is largely conquered.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What is truly groundbreaking about "Loving Vincent" is that every frame of the film is an oil painting on canvas, using the very same technique in which Vincent himself painted. And what makes it a great story to experience is the intriguing, tragic, and inspiring story of Vincent Van Gogh himself.

[NEW REWARDS!!!! - SCROLL DOWN]
Imagine yourself in a journey that you could never experience before...
Loving Vincent is an investigation delving into the life and controversial death of Vincent Van Gogh, one of the world's most beloved painters, as told through his paintings and by the characters that inhabit them. The intrigue unfolds through interviews with the characters closest to Vincent and through dramatic reconstructions of the events leading up to his death.
Here are some stills from our concept trailer:
Loving Vincent features over 120 of Vincent Van Gogh's greatest paintings. The plot, drawn from the 800 letters written by the painter himself, leads us to the significant people and events in the time leading up to his unexpected death. Vincent wrote in his last letter: “Well, the truth is, we cannot speak other than by our paintings”, and that is what we are doing- letting his paintings tell the story of what the painter had inside his heart, and ultimately, what happened to him.
ALL OF THAT HAPPENS INSIDE OF YOUR FAVOURITE PAINTINGS!!
Was it suicide, or was he shot? And if it was suicide, what would have led him to such a dramatic act, when he at last was gaining recognition for his work?
Every film you see is actually a collection of still images, played back at a speed that makes it appear to be moving. In our film about Vincent Van Gogh, EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THESE individual images will be a painting in the style of Van Gogh. That means our 40 painters (which we will be able to train thanks to YOUR support) will create 56,800 PAINTINGS to make this film!! To make this possible OUR WONDERFUL TEAM created PAWS (Painted Animation Work Stations) that allows us to make the demanding process of stop-motion painting as efficient as possible, by allowing our artists to focus on the painting as opposed to the animation. In fact, over the past 18 months of R&D we've managed to halve the painting time of each frame, while maintaining the individuality of the painters.
THIS IS WHAT "PAWS" LOOKS LIKE:
Vincent Van Gogh is often cited as the father of modern art, and his painting Starry Night is regarded as the most famous painting of all time, after the Mona Lisa. He is known for struggling with mental illness and cutting off his left ear, and also for only ever selling one painting in his lifetime and for shooting himself at the age of 37. What isn't widely known is that Vincent only picked up a paintbrush a mere 8 years before his untimely death, after failed careers as first an art dealer, a book sales clerk and then a preacher.
In his short career as a painter HE MANAGED TO PRODUCE AS MANY OR MORE paintings than great masters managed over careers spanning many decades. He went from being a jobless 29-year-old living in a barn in a poor mining area, having never picked up a paintbrush, to, at 37 years old, being proclaimed by one of Paris's (and therefore at the time the world's) most influential art critics as:
"a messiah, a sower of truth, who would regenerate the decrepitude of our art and perhaps our imbecile and industrialist society"
IMPRESSED? WE WERE!
The most important thing for us is to bring this really amazing story to life. We would like to SHARE with you our feelings on the work and life of this extraordinary and inspiring individual.
We are an Oscar-winning animation studio (Founder Hugh Welchman won the Oscar for Best Short Animation for Peter and the Wolf). From the very beginning, our recipe for success has consisted of finding stories and ideas that passionately move us and then going further than anyone else would reasonably expect us to go to make them a unique and brilliant experience for the people watching them. (Here are some links to our work so you can judge for yourself).
https://itunes.apple.com/us/movie/peter-and-the-wolf/id614133162
https://itunes.apple.com/us/movie/the-magic-piano/id663274306
https://itunes.apple.com/us/movie/chopin-shorts-art-collection/id663317230
https://itunes.apple.com/us/movie/chopin-shorts-fantasy-collection/id663307150
https://itunes.apple.com/us/movie/chopin-shorts-kids-collection/id663321315
https://itunes.apple.com/us/movie/chopin-shorts-mixing-worlds/id663326727

BreakThru has collected over twenty international awards & nominations, including two BAFTA nominations, an official selection at Cannes, the Annecy Cristal and Annecy Audience awards, Canal+ Prize, TCM prize, the Rose D’ Or as well as an Oscar for Best Short Animation Film for Peter & The Wolf.
NEW UPDATE!! [13.01.2014]
In the video below, Hugh Welchman will take you for a tour inside of our studio, where all the magic happens and present the rewards:
PLAY

We're at in the final stages of pre-production. And we need your help! Your contribution will not only help us train painters in animation, but will show others that this is a film people want to see happen!
If we achieve our Kickstarter goal, we'd have the opportunity to TEST OVER 200 PAINTERS AND TRAIN 60, preparing them to work on the project. Your contribution will also help us FINALIZE PRE PRODUCTION AND START PAINTING THE FINAL FILM.
The painters we are auditioning - each audition takes 3 days - are all highly qualified painters, many of whom are working in temporary jobs or jobs that in no way use their specialist skills. Your support will not only be helping create the world’s first painting animation feature film, not only be bringing great paintings of Vincent Van Gogh to life, you will be helping talented painters, young and old, find a suitable outlet for their artistic flair.
You are the person that can help make this happen! if you like the project, it's just a choice of pledge. And remember – a pledge of even one pound is not just about the money: It’s about showing support to get this film made!
TAKING PART is EASY. It's just a few simple steps:
1. Click the "BACK THIS PROJECT" green button to the right of our appeal video.
2. SIGN UP (if you are not signed up already)
3. CHOOSE THE REWARD and PLEDGE!
If you like "Loving Vincent" PLEASE SHARE this page with your friends!
[NEW REWARDS UPDATE - 20.01.2014]
Today we have a great treat! New REWARDS are ready to be announced! ;)
To make a long story short, here they are:
1. A marvelous collection of THREE FRIDGE MAGNETS with scenes from our trailer on them! All of it produced from bio-degardable materials. Don't you want one for your place?
Price: 7 GBP
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2. A Loving Vincent's original MUG... for the pleasure of your morning coffee!
Price: 20 pounds
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3. A set of 6 beautifully desiged COASTERS
Price: 10 pounds
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4. A PAINTER SPONSORSHIP PACK
This is ONCE IN A LIFETIME OPPORTUNITY to sponsor a Painter in our project! By buying this REWARD, you can support learning efforts of one our our Painters.
As a SPONSOR you will get:
** one of the paintings created by YOUR PAINTER during their training (you will be able to chose which painting and painter),
** A DVD with the all the animation painted during the training by YOUR PAINTER,
** the set of paintbrushes, used by YOUR PAINTER in the training process.
Price: 600 pounds
DON'T MISS THEM!
P.S. JUST A REMINDER: If you'd like to get a few rewards, just sum up their prices, PLEDGE and message us with the list of your choice... (example: If I'd like to get a DVD for 40 pounds and the VLogs access for 5 pounds; I just pledge 45 pounds)!
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[NEW REWARDS UPDATE - 17.01.2014]
LOVING VINCENT - SPECIAL KICKSTARTER LIMITED EDITION DVD!
Responding to many of your requests, we had decided to ADD a new reward to our campaign: A "LOVING VINCENT" - SPECIAL KICKSTARTER LIMITED EDITION DVD! It will include the movie itself, both with full of special bonus videos, produced during the production process and A SPECIAL THANKS VIDEO from the Producer and the Director of the movie!!
The video is available as a separate reward and it's also included AS A BONUS in all the rewards "+150 GBP". If you want the DVD, but you had already pledged less; you can always add to your pledge the amount of "+40 GBP" to get your chosen award AND DVD...
 ATTENTION! We had previously only included rewards that we knew we could deliver, if the Kickstarter campaign is a success, and completion of the film is definitely down the road once financing is raised. However, due to your requests, we have chosen to include THE LIMITED EDITION KICKSTARTER DVD as a reward, as so many of you had requested it... but YOU SHOULD BE AWARE that this reward is a bit risky, as it is going to be delivered after the production of the movie is over, so in case the film doesn't get made, we unfortunately won't be able to deliver it. To cut a long story short - if you pledge for this reward, you do it at your own risk. We do believe we are close to gathering the production financing, but until everything is signed, on the dotted line can't guarantee that it will.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You can find out more about the project here:
WWW : www.lovingvincent.com

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have specifically chosen a goal that we know we can achieve if we meet our fundraising goal – testing and training painters in animation, and completion of pre-production. But obviously our ultimate goal is to MAKE THIS FILM. We are at an advanced stage in raising the production funding for Loving Vincent, and have recently been awarded a production grant from the Polish Film Institute. But there’s no guarantee that we can raise the rest of the money to begin production. 

And that’s where YOUR support comes in! By achieving this goal, we will not only be able to train painters for work on the film, but will be able to show finance partners who are close to committing that there is indeed an eager audience for the film. 

So in short – we can deliver all the rewards to you right away for your support, and also achieve our goal of testing and training painters - often people with a passion and talent for painting, but who have had to, after university, confine that talent to a weekend hobby room.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Link to the on-going Loving Vincent Kickstarter campaign: http://kck.st/1jStXOo

Hello Kickstarters!
So we just got our relaunch of Loving Vincent approved by kickstarter! I know many of you have asked about the possibility to support the relaunch, and I really hope you'll help us to achieve our goal, as we're anxious to start training painters to work on this very ambitious film.
If you'd like to renew your pledge, please visit our new project page: http://kck.st/1eNBCW4
PLAY
Dear Backers...

The 1st & 2nd February 1890, 124 years ago is in some ways the catalyst that sets the drama in motion in our film. These were watershed days in Vincent’s life.
On the 1st February he received a letter from his beloved younger brother, Theo, who had been Vincent’s entire source of support, financial and also emotional, in his eight year odyssey to become an artist, in fact it was his brother Theo who encouraged the unemployed and despondent Vincent to try his hand at art after having failed careers as an art dealer’s apprentice, a teacher, a book-seller’s apprentice and an evangelical missionary.

Dear Backers,

We've just added a new reward to our campaign - a DIGITAL COPY of "Loving Vincent" for just 15 GBP. If you want to get this reward and you have pledged something before, just ADD +15 GBP to your existing pledge and send us a message.

campaign.story:
SUCCESS! Thank you everyone for your support and getting us to our funding goal! Our appreciation and excitement knows no bounds! Personally, I am doing a happy dance right now! We can't wait to print this book! Having reached the goal, the book can be printed and we are including the short bonus comic, The Three Lazy Ones, in the book.
That being said, there's still 28 hours to go for our campaign. There's still time to stretch! If we get to $28k before the end, everyone who ordered a print copy of Erstwhile Vol.2 will also receive a 4" x 6" sheet of stickers. (see "updates" page for preview image)
_____________________________________________
ERSTWHILE is an anthology project adapting the lesser-known GRIMM'S FAIRY TALES. That means you won't be seeing the same old-same old when you open this book. The tales are not watered down versions, but the real deal. The dark stuff is not edited out for mass consumption, but it is illustrated in a tasteful way to make the comics suitable for both kids and adults. There are three artists on this collaborative project, Gina Biggs, Louisa Roy, and Elle Skinner. Each have their own distinctive style and each of these ladies takes a turn at illustrating one of the tales.
Those of you who are new to Erstwhile please feel free to read the ENTIRE series online for FREE! If you like what you see, come on back and support our kickstarter.
Follow us at: ERSTWHILE SITE | TWITTER | FACEBOOK
Erstwhile volume 2 is a FULL COLOR HARDCOVER book weighing in at 176 pages. Volume 2 contain six completed tales; Brother & Sister, Iron Hans, Snow White & Rose Red, Death of the Little Hen, Doctor Know-It-All, and The Worn-out Dancing Shoes (aka The 12 Dancing Princesses). Each volume of Erstwhile contains its own set of completed stories, so you can jump in at any time to enjoy. 
Erstwhile volume 1 is also available in some pledge levels or you can include it as an ADD-ON item (more info below). Volume 1 contains the following stories: The Farmer's Clever Daughter; A Tale with a Riddle; Maid Maleen; The Bird, the Mouse, & the Sausage; All Fur; The Little Shroud; The Old Man & his Grandson; and The Sweet Porridge.
Snow White & Rose Red introduces us to two sisters who are as different as night and day, but love each other dearly and always promise to share everything between them. Everything goes as planned until a kindly talking bear and an evil dwarf change their lives completely.
Brother & Sister tells the tale of two abused children who run away from home. Once alone in an enchanted forest the brother falls under a curse, transforming him into a wild creature, and the sister finds herself wooed by a king.
Iron Hans is a story of growing up. A young spoiled prince accidentally frees the wild man, Iron Hans, while selfishly trying to acquire his lost golden ball. He runs away from home, fearful of punishment, but once on his own finds both pride in his work and meaning to his life.
Death of the Little Hen follows the hilariously morbid tale of a Rooster and his selfish wife, Hen. The biggest nut on Nut Mountain is greedily gobbled up by Hen and leads to her death, but the tragedy only leads to more mayhem as Rooster and friends travel to the funeral.
Doctor Know-It-All is a man who knows everything, or at least appears that way. The poor farmer in disguise finds himself in over his head when a wealthy merchant hires him to discover the mystery behind the thefts in his household.
The Worn-out Dancing Shoes (aka The 12 Dancing Princesses) tells of twelve royal sisters who awake each morning with their shoes worn to shreds and their bodies worn to exhaustion. The king declares whomever solves the mystery will succeed him to the throne, but whomever fails will get the axe.
_____________________________________________
ADD ONS
If you want to add an extra copy of Erstwhile Vol.1 or Erstwhile Vol.2 to any pledge level you can do so. All you have to do is add an additional amount to your pledge. When the kickstarter ends you will receive a survey that will ask you what (if any) extra items were added to your pledge and you fill it in with what you wanted.
Erstwhile VOLUME 1 (print) - Add $18 for each extra copy you wish to receive.
Erstwhile VOLUME 2 (print) - Add $20 for each extra copy you wish to receive.
Red String Omnibus 1 (print) - Add $30 for each extra copy you wish to receive. (digital) - Add $10 to your pledge.
Red String Omnibus 2 (print) - Add $30 for each extra copy you wish to receive. (digital) - Add $10 to your pledge.
** INTERNATIONAL ORDERS (Outside of the USA. No extra fees for FPO.) Add an additional $5 for each extra copy of a book you order to cover shipping costs.
_____________________________________________
WHERE THE MONEY GOES
The largest chunk of the money earned from this kickstarter will go toward the printing of 2000 copies of the book, followed by the shipping costs from the printer to us. The book itself is being printed by a professional offset printer. Another chunk of the money goes to shipping the books and other goodies out to all of you wonderful people. Ten percent of the earnings will go toward the kickstarter and amazon payment fees. Another portion will go toward the printing/creation of the other kickstarter goodies. Whatever is left will go toward paying the artists and taxes.
_____________________________________________
_____________________________________________
ONE WISH PACKAGE. 
There are over 300 fairy tales in the Grimm's collection, so there is no way we will ever get to all of them in our lifetime. That being said, this is your chance to ensure your favorite fairy tale gets illustrated by the Erstwhile team.YOU CHOOSE the next Grimm's fairy tale we illustrate. You will get updates and previews on the comic's progress, and a printed single-issue comic copy of the story. You will be the FIRST to read it before any of the other readers on the website. The only stories we will not do are the anti-Semitic tales or overly religious tales. Otherwise, as long as it's a Grimm's tale, whether it's a rare or popular title, we will illustrate it!
_____________________________________________
STRETCH GOALS
After we've reached our goal, these awesome bonuses are available at these new goals!
$28k - Everyone who ordered a print copy of Erstwhile Vol.2 will also receive a 4" x 6" sheet of stickers.  
$30k - Everyone who pledges any amount will receive a digital copy of the Erstwhile mini-Artbook. It contains a collection of completed illustrations and concept art.  
$35k - Everyone who ordered a print copy of Erstwhile Vol.2 will also receive a beautiful 6"x9" print.  
$40k - We will offer pledgers the opportunity to vote on the next Grimm's fairy tale we illustrate. We have a whole lineup of stories we intend to illustrate at some point, but it takes us a while to complete each tale (we're only human, after all). This is your chance to have a say on which story YOU want to see illustrated next.
_____________________________________________
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As of this point, 90% of the book is completed. The final story is being illustrated as this campaign runs, so there is no worry about artists getting materials in on time. There are some final production pages that need finishing (the thank you page for pledgers, any extras that are added to the book, etc), but that should not hold up finishing the book in a timely manner.

There is always the possibility of production delays from the printer. We have tried to estimate that into our delivery dates, but sometimes things just get held up at this stage. That said, we would keep you up to date in all stages of the process from printing to shipping.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Erstwhile Fairy Tales Volume 3 Has 48 Hours Left!
updates.update_content: Hey folks! Erstwhile Fairy Tales has just under 48 hours left! Grab it while you can!

The campaign for the third and final volume of the Erstwhile Fairytale series is now live on kickstarter! Complete your set with this striking hardcover book!
Erstwhile presents you with a collection of the lesser-known tales, bringing you a world filled with brave, intelligent female characters and POC heroes and heroines!

Get ready because in less than a month’s time we will be launching the kickstarter for the long awaited final book in the Erstwhile Fairy Tales series! Erstwhile faithfully adapts many of the lesser known Grimm’s fairy tales into gorgeous full color comics.
The book will be over 200 pages collecting the final nine stories as well as a short BONUS tale not published on the website; The Singing Springing Lark, King Thrushbeard, The Wolf & the Man, The Twelve Huntsmen, Sweetheart Roland, The Ungrateful Son, The Leftovers, The Wolf & Seven Kids, Mother Holle, and The Golden Key. It will also include lots of extra art and illustrations.

Hello everyone! It's been a while. The third and final Erstwhile book is slated for a kickstarter in the spring/summer this year. In the meantime, GIna is running a kickstarter right now for her other series, LOVE NOT FOUND.
Love Not Found is a full-color sci-fi romance comic about a young woman living in a time where touching has become outdated. She has recently moved to a new planet and finds that touching might not be such a bad idea. Now she is on a quest to find someone who wants to do things the old fashioned way!

Hiya everyone!
Gina Biggs here! So this is as far away as you can get from fairy tales, but I know some of you are just fans of my work in general. I wanted to let you know I am running a new Kickstarter RIGHT NOW for a new project. I'll only be sending this one notice about the project here (won't constantly spam you about it), so I hope you will check it out and if it's up your alley also support the book!

We have completed the second half of the Moon Chicken plushies. They are packed and shipping out tiday. Thank you all for your patience. These little things took way longer than expected to construct. Also, digital mini artbook should be out by next week.
Now got 11 out of 28 moon chicken plushies completely done!
Progress is being made!

We got back from DragonCon on Monday and have been unpacking/reorganizing. It was awesome to meet all of you folks who stopped by the booth who supported the kickstarter. We'll be sending out the promised replacement copies to the no-show orders by early next week.
Just finished the last of the Erstwhile kickstarter art commissions today. Also finished cutting the wings, feet, & beaks for the Moon Chickens. Still have to cut out the bodies, but we should be able to start constructing the chicks by next week.

campaign.story:
Shru has a new (web) home. Visit getshru.com to learn more and to preorder your kitty a Shru.
As seen on
 We are cat entertainment enthusiasts. So are you.
Pet stores offer you cheap and rather uninteresting balls, things-on-strings, and noise makers that entertain for a few minutes, and then end up under your couch, ne'er to be seen again. We've bought many of these toys ourselves, and -- just like you -- face the disappointment on our cats' faces. We here at PDX Pet Design are ready to rock their socks off and move into the next generation of cat entertainment.

Shru is not another cat toy, it's a cat companion.

Shru responds to your cat's play by mimicking a small animal's erratic movement and sound 
Shru is rechargeable through your USB phone charging cord -- never buy batteries again!
Configure Shru to operate in different modes on your laptop's interface
Shru recharging and configuring over USB
What can Shru do and How does it work?
Shru is designed to be your cat's favorite toy and so it can do a lot of things. 
Move back and forth even over carpet
Shake and make cute sounds
Sense obstacles and reverse direction
and most importantly, Shru will sense kitty interactions ( taps, kitty-grabs, and pounces) and try to escape while making lots of noise!
How does Shru do this? Well it's pretty simple.
Shru with top cover removed
Inside of Shru, a Gearmotor turns an offset weight which displaces Shru's center of gravity and the entire toy rolls forward or backward. An on-board angular sensor located on the Printed Circuit Board (PCB), adjusts to different floor types, human and kitty obstacles. 

3D Image of Shru's parts. Weight is highlighted in blue.

Explanation of Funding
Our goal is to offer Kickstarter project backers with Shru cat companions at cost, to get this project rolling. Below, please find some more cost details.
Reward #1 & 2
The final production Shru will cost us $31 per piece to make. You will be receiving Shru at cost price. Because of price-break points we can realize with bulk orders, we need to order parts for 500 of these to sell them to you at cost - $31 per piece. The major costs consist of the plastic enclosure mold (~$10 per piece) and custom electronic components (~17 per piece). Other costs include packaging and shipping. We're providing these final product Shru to Kickstarter backers at cost so that we can get this project some traction for down-the-road investors. 
Reward #3 
Early adopters will pay $125 for a custom-made, first-run edition of Shru. Because we anticipate production of only a handful of these, the cost breakdowns are as follows: $50 - 3D printed hard ellipsoid enclosure $20 - Printed Circuit Board (PCB) $30 - Electronics $15 - Motor and Battery $10 - Packaging and Shipping All net profits from this project will be used for project incidentals and/or funding Phase 3 of this project (see Phase breakdown above).
All net profits from this project will be used for project incidentals and/or funding Phase 3 of this project (see Phase breakdown below).
Production Phases
Phase 1 - Prototype
Phase 1 is complete, and the output of Phase 1 is what you see in the videos and photos above. Refinement of the firmware and extensive cat testing is ongoing. 

Phase 2 - Early Adopter Production
Phase 2 involves the creation of the early adopter prototypes for Reward level 3 backers. In Phase 2, we will take the lessons learned from Phase 1 to make improvements to the electronics, motor design, and enclosure design. Early adopters will provide feedback and receive regular updates based on their suggestions.

Phase 3 - Final Production 
Phase 3 will incorporate the lessons learned from Phase 2 for the final production run, which Reward level 1 and 2 backers will receive.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A well thought-out plan is essential for minimizing unanticipated obstacles, and we've put a lot of critical thought into Phase 1.

1. Failure Analysis will be crucial to the plan. The last thing we want is a poor quality product. Failure analysis has been at the forefront of our minds during prototyping, and will be an ongoing design element during Phase 2 and Phase 3, to ensure a lasting quality product is delivered to project backers.

2. Uninterested or scared cat. Part of the early adopter program will be to identify those most discriminating and hard-to-please cats, and correspondingly tweaking the Shru design to bring out the little tiger in every last cat.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What is 21 Revolutions? 
The 21 Revolutions project is the winner of the 2013 Arts & Business Scotland 'Enterprising Museum of the Year' Award. We need your support to create the 21 Revolutions publication and have lovely rewards to offer in return.
In 2012 Glasgow Women’s Library (GWL) celebrated its 21st birthday. To mark two decades of life-changing work, GWL commissioned 21 internationally renowned artists and 21 published writers to create new works inspired by our unique museum, archive and library collections. The resulting fine art prints, poems and creative writing are being brought together with the sources that inspired the work in a superb book alongside essays by Fiona Bradley, Director of the Fruitmarket Gallery, writer and journalist Lesley McDowell, and co-founder of Glasgow Women’s Library Adele Patrick.
All the created art works have been exhibited at the prestigious Royal Scottish Academy, Edinburgh and CCA, Glasgow
 Why is it needed? 
There is no other publication that includes work by Scottish based contemporary women artists and writers. GWL aims to celebrate the hidden history of Scottish women and promote contemporary women’s achievements. This publication does both. Although Scottish women artists and writers have gained increasing prominence over the period of the Library’s life there is still no women’s magazine in Scotland, no anthologies of women’s writing and no survey of contemporary women’s art. This publication spotlights gems from the historic records of women housed by GWL through the lens of 42 contemporary women creatives.
What is the publication like? 
It is unique! It is a beautiful, lushly illustrated, enlightening and readable book. It is a large format paperback with the highest quality reproductions throughout, with fascinating new creative writing and scintillating essays. We have included artists' and writers' biographies, information about how they approached making their creative responses, as well as a detailed survey of numerous resources from the collection used in the creation of these 42 new works.
Members of the GWL team wearing fabulous National Museum of Roller Derby t-shirts available as part of the '21 Revolutions Fans' Goody Bag reward
Why do we need your support?
Creative Scotland generously funded 70% of the production of the 21 Revolutions publication but a remaining £5000 needs to be raised to ensure its successful publication. 
What is the future for GWL and 21 Revolutions? What difference will my support make?
21 Revolutions is testimony to the achievements of Glasgow Women’s Library. 42 of the most significant women artists and writers working in Scotland today agreed to work with the collection and create work that could be used to raise awareness of the Library’s life changing work and resources. Your support of this project will ensure that a fantastic project has a tangible lasting public outcome, that we have a further beautiful work that we can share to promote the history of contemporary women artists and writers and the Library’s resources and that we are able to embark on an exciting and landmark project to develop an imprint at GWL. Your support will make the difference of being able to create this publication without having to compromise our vital services.

Which artists and writers have created works for 21 Revolutions?
Ruth Barker looking at samples for her work 'Scarf for Glasgow Women's Library'. Bookmarks of this stunning work are available as part of the 'I Support GWL' and '21 Revolutions Fans' goody bags as part of our rewards.
The participating visual artists in 21 Revolutions are:
Sam Ainsley
Claire Barclay
Ruth Barker
Karla Black
Nicky Bird
Ashley Cook
Delphine Dallison
Kate Davis
Fiona Dean
Helen de Main
Kate Gibson
Ellie Harrison
Elspeth Lamb
Shauna McMullan
Jacki Parry
Ciara Phillips
Lucy Skaer
Corin Sworn
Sharon Thomas
Amanda Thomson
Sarah Wright
The participating writers are:
Karen Campbell         
Anne Donovan           
Margaret Elphinstone 
Vicki Feaver   
Helen Fitzgerald
Janice Galloway        
Muriel Gray    
Jen Hadfield
Jackie Kay          
A. L. Kennedy
Kirsty Logan    
Laura Marney
Heather Middleton
Alison Miller
Denise Mina   
Donna Moore  
Elizabeth Reeder
Leela Soma
Zoë Strachan
Louise Welsh
Zoë Wicomb
What is Glasgow Women’s Library?
Glasgow Women’s Library is no ordinary Library. It is a national treasure and the only place of its kind in Scotland. A place for browsing, borrowing and being inspired, GWL is welcoming free and open to all. We are an accredited Museum with a wonderful treasure trove of books, artefacts and archive collections contributed by thousands of donors that celebrate the lives, histories and achievements of women. Learning is at the heart of what we do and we aim to widen horizons with  programmes of inspiring events and activities from film screenings to literacy support, heritage walks and exhibitions. We are an enterprising charity specialising in working with a very diverse range of women including BME women and women remote from learning.
International Postage Options
Although our pledges specify that postage is restricted to 'Shipping within the UK only', International postage is available through email correspondence with GWL. This is simply to ensure accurate international postage rates are utilised and you are not over charged for your reward. Please contact us at our email: info@womenslibrary.org.uk
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If 21 Revolutions was unsuccessful in raising the required additional funding for the publication these funds would have to be sourced elsewhere in the GWL budget, from those previously committed to other essential services necessary for the day to day running of the Library and its commitments. The success of this fundraising campaign would mean these funds would not need to be sourced from the important social and community based work of GWL.

Even if we reach our target and can cover our costs, we are aware that our publication could be beset by difficulties around printing and distribution. Creative Scotland (our major funder) and Freight Design, our co-publishers, are providing us with loads of helpful advice and general 'hand-holding' as the publication is developed. We are talking to Freight, who are an award-winning and experienced publishers (the third biggest in Scotland), each day for advice and guidance as we take steps on this publishing adventure. The final proofreading and checking of copyrights and permissions is already underway as we work with Freight's designers to finalise the publication.

We feel confident that working with reputable printers recommended by Freight, and clear communication with all our stakeholders each step of the way (including our donors), will mean that the only real risk we face will be possible delays due to unforeseen circumstances (whether that is to do with the vagaries of the Scottish weather, industrial action or our newness to the distribution business).

The Library itself is a robust organisation with good governance, and creative and effective problem solving is in our DNA. We have been briefed throughout by Freight and other publishing industry professionals on the possible challenges (for example, we have chosen a print run that is sensible for a first edition of this kind and are working with a tried and tested distributor) and feel confident that we are primed to be able to respond to any other surprises that we might encounter.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
As our kickstarter campaign draws to a close, we've just got a couple more testimonials to share with you to further whet your appetite ahead of the 21 Revolutions publication launch new month. 
Today we hear from Dr Sarah Lowndes, writer, curator and author of Social Sculpture: Rise of the Glasgow Art Scene
"21 Revolutions provides a detailed and inspiring insight into the vital work of Glasgow Women's Library since its inception in 1991. This covetable, lavishly illustrated book, features new writings and prints inspired by the GWL collection by the leading luminaries of Scottish arts and letters, including writers A. L. Kennedy, Denise Mina and Louise Welsh and artists Sam Ainsley, Karla Black and Claire Barclay. "

Good Morning Backers,
We are so grateful for all your support.Although we have now reached our target we would be delighted to raise additional funds as this will allow us to distribute more copies of and promote the book.So please do keep telling your friends and family. 
Today we have another testimonial, this time from Joanne Orr the CEO of Museum Galleries Scotland.

We write this morning with very good news indeed.
Thanks to you, our 'Backers', we have reached our target amount of £5,000 for this wonderful Kickstarter Project. 
Glasgow Women's Library's beautiful '21 Revolutions' book will now be published, and launched in March.

updates.update_userinfo: 4th Testimonial - Lynn Abrams, Professor of Modern History, University of Glasgow
updates.update_content: 21 Revolutions marks a turning point in the story of Glasgow Women's Library, showcasing its inspirational qualities for women of all artistic and creative temperaments. The diversity of women's experiences curated by GWL in its collections has acted as a spur to creativity with a feminist edge. From suffrage jewellery to knitting patterns, badges to banners, this rich archive documenting women's pasts has inspired and shaped some of Scotland's best artists to create celebratory works of immense depth and range. The silence and invisibility of the past has been given voice and illuminated by those who care enough to preserve, interpret and re-interpret lives worth remembering.

project_data.project_name: 21 Revolutions

campaign.story:
We came to the Winooski Intervale Valley for its lush soil and proximity to Burlington. Sure, it's a floodplain, but friends who had farmed there for years assured us that the soils were rich and the floods were rare. We were excited. 
In 2010, our first season with 2 acres in production, our pasture flooded in November. In 2011, following the heaviest snowfall on record and the wettest Spring on record, Lake Champlain covered our farm from mid April until mid-June. We plowed on, growing six acres, until Tropical Storm Irene flooded us with nearly seven feet of water on August 29. 
But hey, 2012 was great! One of the best seasons I've ever seen, and our 12 acres of veggies yielded amazing crops to complement our pasture raised pork and eggs, grass fed beef, and lamb. We thought the worst was behind us. Maybe we could stay?
Then 2013. The farm experienced mild but persistent flooding in May, June, and the grand finale on July 5. This year alone we lost an acre and a half of potatoes, a half acre of Spring carrots, an acre of Spring broccoli, cauliflower, and cabbage, an acre of tomatoes, and two acres of winter squash. We cannot survive another season in this new climate. Climate change has brought massive rainstorms, thick snowpacks, and a river with wanderlust. We need to move out of its way. 
Salvation! We've found 20 acres of prime agricultural soils in the high meadows of lovely Plainfield, VT! Best of all, they are well drained sandy loams! Now we need to move there. After another hard season, we need upwards of $25,000 to:
- drill a well (approximately $8,000)
- dig an irrigation pond (approximately $8,000)
- build an equipment shed and vegetable storage (approximately $6,000)
-move our essential equipment, infrastructure, and livestock (approximately $3,500)
We've set our goal at $25,000, but we need every cent we can raise. Climate change is going to affect us all, but we can prove resilient. Save our farms! Save THIS farm! 
and, hey- thank you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Between the two of us, we have over twenty years of farming experience. We've farmed through hell and high water, through the economic recession and through personal crisis, and we'll farm through climate change. 

Moving a farm is complicated business. We've been working with a business planner to create a detailed timeline and economic projection. If at any point during the move we are not keeping with our financial deadlines, we have alternative credit lines available. Our mortgage is already lined up and we have been preapproved for an additional loan to cover our moving costs, in case the kickstarter does not succeed. We are hoping to raise a large portion of the costs through kickstarter, so our farm can emerge from the move as resilient as ever. 

Perhaps the greatest risk we face in moving the farm is that our current farm will flood while we are moving to our new land. We have been adjusting our farm around climate change for the past four seasons. Each flood is slightly different, but we're confident that we have the skills and experience to make it through one more season on the floodplain, as long as we know it's the last one.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: 5 Years since Irene. Final rewards timeline.
updates.update_content: This coming Monday marks five years since Irene flooded our farm with 7 feet of water at the height of the growing season. Looking out on the fields now, I can't imagine loosing all we have out there. Mike and I are still amazed that we made it through, that we are still farming, with largely the same work crew; a crew we love like family. We are half way through our second season on the new farm, and it has held up to 4" of rain in one day, and a month with no rain at all. While farming is always difficult, the peace of mind offered by that fact alone makes the rest of the work worth doing.

updates.update_userinfo: We have 310 Things to be Thankful for...
updates.update_content:
It's been a long time since our last update, and if you don't follow us on Instagram (@tamarackhollowfarm) you probably wonder what we've been up to. I am sorry that I haven't been in touch through the Kickstarter updates. We've been overwhelmed by our competing obligations to the current farm, to the new farm, to our workers, our family, our customers, and our backers. It's been a wild year. 
So what have we been up to? All kind of things...
We've been farming in Burlington. We just wrapped up our best season ever. We had nearly 20 acres in production and amazing weather. In August, we were invited into the Union Square Greenmarket on Saturdays. Going down twice a week has been intense, but it means we've been able to expand our vision for the future of our farm.

Hey there!
It's been a whirlwind year. We're having great weather (so far, fingers crossed) here in Burlington, and making great progress at the new farm in Plainfield. The fields are plowed and harrowed, awaiting an application of agricultural lime to raise the ph. 
We've finished nearly all the clearing, the well is installed, and the water line is buried from the well to the barn site, for real!

Unfortunately, we don't actually get to hibernate. Here on the farm we've been busy with standard end of year wrapping up, like taxes and such. Getting ready for the next year is much more fun: ordering seeds, planning the next year's field maps, re-launching the CSA, and getting ready to close on the new farm! Looks like we'll be closing on Valentine's Day, how romantic! 
I'll be in touch with you all individually as your rewards are ready. We're working on the woodblock and t-shirt designs at the moment... the food items will wait for warmer weather!

Just wanted to drop a quick note to let you know that we haven't forgotten about you! We'll be sending out surveys to collect information relevant to fulfilling your rewards after the new year. I didn't want them to get lost in the shuffle. Enjoy the holiday week!
Cheers, 
Amanda and Mike

updates.update_userinfo: Woo Hoo! You did it! We're there!
updates.update_content:
You did it! We're there! We just broke $25,000! 
Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! We couldn't do it without you! I especially need to thank Aly and Cody for the unbelievable video they put together. Trust me, Aly wasn't working with choice material, but she made a great video that still makes me laugh, and cry a little. 
Big thanks to Quinciple and Kate, GrowNYC Staff and Greenmarkets, Flourish Body Care and Kirsten, Melissa P, Serious Eats NY, Dr. Drew Ramsey, Slow Food NY, Annie N, the Burlington Farmers' Market and Joanne, Alice L, and everyone who posted, retweeted, or emailed our project for all their media support. You guys rock!

Hi friends, family, and supporters!
The kickstarter has been kicking butt and we are so grateful to everyone who has told a friend, put this campaign on social media, made a donation, or otherwise promoted it! You rock!
We have 7 days left, and have $8,750 to get to our goal. This holiday, pass along our campaign to friends and family- it's a great time to be grateful for the food on your plate and the farmers that grow it. Show our video to a friend, and ask if they're able to donate or to show it to someone else, and little by little we'll make our goal!

updates.update_userinfo: Half the time, half the funds!
updates.update_content:
Hi backers and potential backers,
We're half way through our time, and we're half way through our funding! Woo hoo! Thank you all for your generosity and support with this campaign so far. 
We had another darling calf born on Wednesday. We'll post pictures once mom and calf are ready for the spotlight! Now, I've gotta get out there and make your Thanksgiving dinner happen!

campaign.story:
Santorini by Fiona Conrad
Working layout for TAQ Annual
 Scroll down for images of our rewards!
LAST WEEK TO CONTRIBUTE!!!!
The Magazine
Tiny Atlas Quarterly is the culmination of what happens when art directors, designers, photographers, writers, stylists, digital techs, photo assistants and other friends and contributors from the creative corps collaborate on visual projects of their own designing.
It is filled with rich, beautiful stories intended to convey the feelings of a place in time and includes travel details if readers also want to have a similar experience for themselves.
We've produced two issues so far, Spring 2013 and Summer 2013 and they include destinations visited for their beauty, light, intrigue and visual appeal shot on location around the world. A short list of “in the know” places to stay and dine and fun activities accompanies each story, as a way to extend our discoveries to our readers. 
Working layout for TAQ Annual, Southern
Bend, Oregon by Emily Nathan
Justin Ruhl image of surfer Keith Malloy
Founder
 A few words from founder Emily Nathan about why she undertook this Tiny Atlas Quarterly adventure in the first place: 
Bend, Oregon by Emily Nathan
 “When I’m working for clients, I’m trying to capture a perfect image. We’re always after the sunniest, bluest sky or the perfectly sculpted still life. Rarely do I get to join forces with my colleagues with the sole purpose of capturing something else, something less than perfect, but, perhaps, more beautiful.” 
Landrum, South Carolina
Thayer Gowdy
“Tiny Atlas Quarterly is a way to show the images we’re most drawn to – maybe it’s a storm sweeping over a mountain range, a quiet look, or just a silly moment – and the places and things we love and want to share.” 
Working layout for TAQ annual, Jenner
Our Next Issue- Fall 2013
Erin Kunkel shoots in British Columbia, coming soon!
The Fall 2013 online issue is currently in production. Highlights include:
-Photographer Emily Nathan (ba-reps.com) goes deep into South Kona, Hawaii with artist Klea McKenna (kleamckenna.com) and TAQ Arts Editor and curator Aimee Friberg (CULTexhibitions.com) as Klea makes photograms in the jungle where she spent her early years. 
 -Photographer/adventurer Erin Kunkel (erinkunkel.com) and her surfboard shaper husband Danny Hess (hesssurfboards.com) surf and fish in remote Nootka Island off the coast of Vancouver Island, British Columbia. 
-An autumn weekend excursion to a farm in the Catskills with photographer Tara Donne (taradonne.com), Nicolette Camille (nicolettecamille.com) from the Little Flower School in New York (little-flower-school.blogspot.com) and artist Dana McClure (danamcclure.com) foraging for fall foliage and gathering with friends for a harvest meal. 
Further imagery and stories from Jaime Beechum in The Dominican Republic, from Shelly Strazis in Portland, Oregon, Southern France and Formentera, Spain. Find Collin Erie in Ethiopia, Daeja Fallas in New York City, Ashley Camper in Hawaii and more. 
Shelly Strazis in Portland, Oregon
New Zealand, by Emily Nathan
The Future
In addition to the Fall 2013 issue currently in production, we have exciting plans for a limited edition Tiny Atlas Quarterly printed annual edition. The printed version will celebrate all of the work we've done to date, and bring Tiny Atlas Quarterly off your screens, into the world, and hopefully, into your hands. 
In order to produce the Fall 2013 issue, as well as to print a beautiful heavy-weight matte annual issue, we need partners. Tiny Atlas Quarterly has been a completely unfunded and independent publication. All of the funds needed to produce the issues so far have come from our contributors' own savings and donated time. 
While we're head-over-heels in love with the process of making this magazine and expanding our wonderful and growing community of creators and readers, we no longer can continue without outside funds. This is where you all come in. By donating at any level you become part of Tiny Atlas Quarterly. If you love magazines, beautiful art and photography, and want to learn about off-the-radar destinations- donate to our campaign so we can give you lots to love back.
In the meantime, we have plenty to offer you already, at our site  TinyAtlasQuarterly.com, and by way of pledge rewards. We hope you enjoy!
Yuba River with Tahiti Pehrson by Emily Nathan
The Campaign
All funds raised will be used to produce and print our first annual printed edition, in tandem with production of our next online issue (Fall 2013).
Our first print run will be 3,000 copies. (We'll print additional copies if the campaign exceeds our first goal.)
We're looking to raise $22,000, which would cover our printing and shipping costs from an esteemed printer in Vancouver, as well as some of our production costs for our site's development, design, illustration, writing, editing and photography for the Fall issue and the printed annual.
Additionally this campaign will help us build the Tiny Atlas Quarterly community. The more people we can reach, the more we can collaborate in the future, sharing our stories, in an exceptional and dynamic way.
Montana by Emily Nathan
Other Ways You Can Help
If you love Tiny Atlas Quarterly, please pass it on! We are looking to get the word out to people like yourself, who appreciate and see the value of what we're doing and want to contribute, too. 
Montana by Emily Nathan
Jaime Beechum
